intro: Roydsia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered roydsia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact stature and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Roydsia parviflora is typically found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
